Articles.Content:
There is the stock equipment like the station core and ion probe but I was wondering how I would go about putting them on top of a booster I downloaded that has an empty spot at the top for a payload. Or do I have to build a rocket under them myself?

Edited January 6, 2014 by DJRWolf

If that booster's empty spot is on the booster's root part (i.e. the part by which you can drag the whole booster around by left-click without shift), you can save the booster as a subassembly. Then load your part, load the booster subassembly and stick it below your payload.

I could not get the payload (in this case the core section of a space station) to save as a sub-assembly but I was able to get the pre-built "T-9" booster I downloaded to save. Trouble I've been having since then is it skips to the last stage after the first stage is done. I manged to get it to stage right once but I goofed on the MechJeb autopilot setting and had to revert. Now I just need to un-derp the staging. Thank you
If both your booster and your payload have stages, you need to create enough empty stages in the staging column before you attach the subassembly to prevent them merging in a strange way.
